蘋果更新隱私權網頁 3大原則保障用戶
07 Nov 2019, 00:05 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, 中央通訊社
（中央社記者吳家豪台北6日電）蘋果公司（Apple）今天更新隱私權網頁，說明今年推出有關隱私保護和安全性的新功能，並注重減少從用戶蒐集的資訊、盡量在裝置處理數據、讓蒐集數據過程透明化3大原則。
蘋果在新版隱私權網頁指出，隱私是基本人權，也是蘋果的核心價值之一。無論用戶要分享何種體驗、分享給誰，決定權都在於用戶。因此蘋果在設計每項產品時，都要為用戶的隱私提供保障，並讓用戶掌控自身資訊。
事實上，蘋果向來對隱私保護採取幾個一貫原則。第一，盡量減少從用戶蒐集到的資訊；第二，盡量在設備或裝置端進行數據處理，減少透過蘋果處理數據的機會；第三，如果一定要蒐集數據，也會讓過程透明，例如讓用戶了解為何要蒐集這些數據。
舉例來說，在iOS 13內，用戶可以選擇僅限一次或每次使用APP時都授權APP存取位置的權限。如果某個APP在背景使用用戶的位置資訊時，用戶會收到通知，讓用戶可以自行決定是否更新這項權限。
當用戶使用今年推出的「使用Apple登入」功能時，網站或APP最多只能詢問姓名和電子郵件地址，而且蘋果不會追蹤或記錄用戶的描述檔。
在這次隱私權網頁更新中，蘋果針對主要功能和服務都加強了隱私保護。例如某些網站允許數百家不同的數據蒐集公司追蹤用戶活動、建立用戶的描述檔，並且在用戶瀏覽網頁時發送廣告；現在，Safari預設開啟的「智能防追蹤」功能運用裝置上的機器學習技術，能幫助用戶阻擋這些追蹤者。
針對常用的「照片」APP，「回憶」和「分享建議」功能會使用裝置本身的智慧功能去分析照片，並依照不同面孔、地點等資訊加以整理，所有過程都在用戶的裝置上進行，蘋果無法得知相簿有哪些人物或事物。而「共享控制」功能可以讓用戶與好友或APP分享照片時，自行決定是否包含照片位置、編輯紀錄和景深資料。
在Siri語音助理中，隱私保護也受到重視。例如對Siri提出語音要求在Safari內搜尋時，仍需要來自蘋果伺服器的即時資料。當蘋果必須傳送資訊到某個伺服器時，會使用一組隨機識別碼來保護用戶隱私，不會關聯到用戶的Apple ID。
隨機識別碼還應用在Apple地圖，使用「地圖」APP不用登入，而且使用時收集的資料如搜尋字詞、導航路線及交通資訊等，都與隨機識別碼關聯。
此外，當用戶把信用卡或金融卡加入Apple Pay時，實際卡號不會儲存在裝置或蘋果伺服器上，因此蘋果無法追蹤購買內容，也無法建立購買紀錄發送廣告。
總結來說，蘋果希望盡量減少資料傳送來提供相關服務，並透過裝置上的智慧功能創造個人化的使用體驗，不必依賴蘋果伺服器分析個人資訊。即使在資料必須傳送到蘋果伺服器的情況下，也能隱藏用戶的個人身分，有時會採用隨機識別碼，讓傳送的資料不會與用戶的Apple ID產生關聯，藉此保護用戶隱私。（編輯：張良知）1081106

Apple updates privacy page 3 principles to protect users
07 Nov 2019, 00:05 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, Central News Agency
(Central News Agency reporter Wu Jiahao, Taipei, 6th) Apple has updated its privacy page today to showcase new features for privacy protection and security this year, with a focus on reducing information collected from users, processing data on devices, and collecting data. The three principles of process transparency.
Apple pointed out in the new privacy page that privacy is a basic human right and one of Apple's core values. Regardless of the experience users share and who they share, the decision is based on the user. Therefore, when designing each product, Apple must protect the privacy of users and let users control their own information.
In fact, Apple has always adopted several consistent principles for privacy protection. First, try to reduce the information collected from users; second, try to process data on the device or device side, reduce the chance of processing data through Apple; third, if you must collect data, the process will be transparent, for example Users understand why they want to collect this data.
For example, in iOS 13, the user can choose to grant the APP access to the location only once or each time the app is used. If an app uses the user's location information in the background, the user will be notified that the user can decide whether to update this permission.
When users use the "Use Apple Login" feature launched this year, the website or APP can only ask for names and email addresses at most, and Apple will not track or record the user's profile.
In this privacy page update, Apple has enhanced privacy protection for key features and services. For example, some websites allow hundreds of different data collection companies to track user activity, create user profiles, and send advertisements when users browse the web; now, Safari's default "Intelligent Anti-Tracking" feature is used to access the devices on the device. Learning technology can help users block these followers.
For the commonly used "Photos" app, the "Recall" and "Share Suggestion" functions will use the smart features of the device to analyze the photos and organize them according to different faces, locations, etc. All processes are performed on the user's device, Apple I don't know which characters or things are in the album. The "Share Control" feature allows users to decide whether or not to include photo locations, edit history, and depth of field information when sharing photos with friends or apps.
In the Siri voice assistant, privacy protection is also taken seriously. For example, when Siri asks for voice requests to search within Safari, instant data from the Apple server is still needed. When Apple has to send information to a server, it uses a random set of identifiers to protect user privacy and is not associated with the user's Apple ID.
The random identification code is also applied to the Apple map. The "Map" APP is not required to log in, and the data collected during use, such as search terms, navigation routes and traffic information, are associated with the random identification code.
In addition, when a user adds a credit card or a financial card to Apple Pay, the actual card number is not stored on the device or the Apple server, so Apple cannot track the purchase content, nor can it establish a purchase record to send an advertisement.
In summary, Apple wants to minimize data transfer to provide relevant services, and to create a personalized experience through the smart features of the device, without relying on the Apple server to analyze personal information. Even when the data must be transmitted to the Apple server, the user's personal identity can be hidden, and sometimes the random identification code is used, so that the transmitted data is not associated with the user's Apple ID, thereby protecting the user's privacy.
